content.webTitle: Bristol Academy knock Barcelona out of Women’s Champions League

fields.headline: Bristol Academy knock Barcelona out of Women’s Champions League
fields.bodyText: Nikki Watts’ late penalty gave Bristol Academy a famous win over Barcelona in the last 16 of the Women’s Champions League, taking them into the quarter-finals for the first time. The Women’s Super League team, who qualified for the competition after finishing second in last year’s domestic competition, had beaten the Spanish champions 1-0 in Spain five days previously – ending their opponents’ 55-game unbeaten run at home – and needed only to avoid defeat to secure their progress. They were pegged back by their visitors throughout a tense first half at Ashton Gate, and Barcelona drew level on aggregate shortly before half-time when Maria Losada scored after a disputed free-kick. The home side controlled the second period and the decisive moment came seven minutes from time when, after Natasha Harding had been fouled, Watts scored calmly from the spot. Bristol saw out a nerve-wracking final flurry from the Catalan side and, in front of a 2,457-strong home crowd, won through to a last-eight draw that includes the Scottish side Glasgow City.
